title: Firewall
subtitle: Select a VM to enable or view its firewall rules
pageDescription: By default, the firewall blocks all incoming traffic. When enabled, the VM will be unavailable until the correct ports are allowed.
activeModalDesc: By default, the firewall blocks all incoming traffic. When enabled, the VM will be unavailable until the correct ports are allowed.
deleteModalDesc: Deleting the firewall will remove all inbound rules and expose the VM to all external connections.
actionTooltip: Defines the rule behavior: Accept allows traffic, Drop blocks traffic.
protocolTooltip: Choose the rule protocol, such as TCP, UDP, HTTP, HTTPS or Any (any protocol).
portOrRangeTooltip: The port or range of ports affected by the rule (e.g., 80 for HTTP or 1000-2000 for a range).
ipAddressTooltip: Select the IP type (IPv4 or IPv6) of the chosen VM.
originTooltip: IP or IP range allowed to access the port. Use Any to allow all IPs.
descriptionTooltip: Additional info about the origin, such as a description or CIDR range (e.g., 192.168.1.0/24).
createRuleConfirmation: Are you sure you want to create this rule?
createRuleNote: It will be applied immediately and can be edited at any time.
deleteRuleConfirmation: Are you sure you want to delete this rule?
deleteRuleNote: This action is permanent and cannot be undone.
editRuleNote: By default, the firewall blocks all incoming traffic. When enabled, the VM will be unavailable until the correct ports are allowed.
enterValidIPv4: Please enter a valid IPv4 address
enterValidIPv6: Please enter a valid IPv6 address
versionTargetTooltip: If there is no version change after 1 minute of updating the rules, investigate possible failures.
